meanings.definition: Able to be seen or noticed.
meanings.sent1: The bright colors of the flowers were easily perceivable from afar.
meanings.sent2: The small details on the painting were perceivable only up close.
meanings.sent3: The cat's attempt to hide behind the curtain was perceivable but amusing.
meanings.sent4: The impact of her words was perceivable in the silence that followed.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the approaching train grew louder and more perceivable.

meanings.definition: Capable of being perceived by the senses.
meanings.sent1: The delicious aroma of the freshly baked cookies was easily perceivable.
meanings.sent2: The cold wind on his face was perceivable as he stepped outside.
meanings.sent3: The dog's excitement at the park was perceivable through its wagging tail.
meanings.sent4: The tension in the room was perceivable, making everyone uneasy.
meanings.sent5: The taste of the exotic fruit was so unique and perceivable.
